name: Naomi Shelton
description: '''Naomi Davis Shelton''' (born '''Naomi Virginia Davis'''; October 14, 1942 â€“ February 17, 2021) was an American [[gospel music|gospel]], [[blues]], [[funk]], and [[soul music|soul]] musician, who played [[traditional black gospel]], [[deep funk]], [[northern soul]] and [[rhythm and blues]] styles of music. She started her music career, in 1958, after she graduated from high school in Alabama. Davis was the lead singer of The Gospel Queens from [[Brooklyn]], later known as [[Naomi Shelton & the Gospel Queens]].
